summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for August 9, 2019. It records staff observations of inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, and includes signatures of reviewing officers. The sheets cover multiple tiers (L, M, ZA, ZB) and shifts (Morning, Day, Evening Watch).

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Staff conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous locked-down status throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing 30-minute observation checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The checks were conducted on August 9, 2019, covering multiple tiers (L, M, ZA, ZB) and shifts (Morning, Day, Evening Watch).
The procedure required staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule, with observations no more than 40 minutes apart.
The document includes signature blocks for staff and is reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document does not name any specific inmates or staff members, only recording time frames and signatures.
